maml:description.maml:para: Converts a PSCustomObject to a hashtable.
The "Convert-PSCustomObjectToHashtable" cmdlet iterates over a PSCustomObject's properties and adds name-value pairs to a hastable that it returns.

maml:Description.maml:para: The PSCustomObject that is to be converted.
The PSCustomObject that is to be converted.

maml:description.maml:para: Downloads a file from a URL.
The "Get-FileFromWeb" cmdlet uses different methods to download a file from a URL and saves it to a desired location.

maml:Description.maml:para: The URL where the requested resource is located.
The path to where the requested file is to be saved to.
The download function that is to be used.
The URL where the requested resource is located.
The path to where the requested file is to be saved to.
The download function that is to be used.

maml:alert.maml:para: Download method "BITS" can display its progress, but can also be delayed by other downloads. Download method "WebClient" cannot display its progress. Download method "WebRequest" can display its progress, but is very slow.

maml:description.maml:para: Ensures that a path does not already exist.
The "Initialize-TaskPath" cmdlet checks whether a path exists and, depending on the "Overwrite" flag, deletes that path or throws an error.

maml:Description.maml:para: The path that is to be checked.
Whether to remove the given path.
The path that is to be checked.
Whether to remove the given path.

maml:description.maml:para: Invokes an expression without causing crashes.

The "Invoke-ExpressionSafe" cmdlet Invokes the given command redirecting errors into a temporary file and other output into a variable. If the WithError parameter is given, the temporary file's output is appended to stdout. If the Graceful parameter is given and an error occurs, no exception is be thrown.

maml:Description.maml:para: The expression to invoke safely.
Whether to return the host message in stdout.
Whether to return the error message in stdout.
Prevents that an error is thrown.
The expression to invoke safely.
Whether to return the host message in stdout.
Whether to return the error message in stdout.
Prevents that an error is thrown.

maml:description.maml:para: Download a file and displays a progress bar.
The "Invoke-WebRequestWithProgress" cmdlet creates a HttpWebRequest whose response stream is directed to a file. Every 10KB a progress bar showing the current download progress is displayed/updated.

maml:Description.maml:para: The URI of the file that is to be downloaded.
The path to where the file is to be saved to.
How long to wait for a connection success.
Whether to overwrite an already existing downloaded file.
The URI of the file that is to be downloaded.
The path to where the file is to be saved to.
How long to wait for a connection success.
Whether to overwrite an already existing downloaded file.

maml:description.maml:para: Merges two objects into one.
The "Merge-Objects" cmdlet adds all properties of the first object and the second object to a third one and returns the latter.

maml:Description.maml:para: The first source object.
The second source object.
The first source object.
The second source object.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets environment variable from an .env file.
The "Mount-EnvFile" cmdlet reads and parses each valid line from an .env file and sets the corresponding Windows environment variable.

maml:Description.maml:para: Path to the .env file that is to be mounted.
Path to the .env file that is to be mounted.

maml:description.maml:para: Reads all PowerShell function names from a string.
The "Read-FunctionNames" cmdlet parses the input string and returns all findings of function names inside it.

maml:Description.maml:para: The string that is to be searched through.
The string that is to be searched through.

dev:type.maml:name: Sorted by the functions' order of occurrence.

maml:description.maml:para: Asks the user for his/her answer to a question.
The "Read-Prompt" cmdlet prompts the user for a choice regarding a question with the given parameters.

maml:Description.maml:para: The caption that is to be displayed.
The message that is to be displayed.
A list of "Management.Automation.Host.ChoiceDescription"s the user can choose from.
The choice that is selected by default.
The caption that is to be displayed.
The message that is to be displayed.
A list of "Management.Automation.Host.ChoiceDescription"s the user can choose from.
The choice that is selected by default.

dev:remarks.maml:para: (New-Object Management.Automation.Host.ChoiceDescription -ArgumentList 'Docker for Windows'), (New-Object Management.Automation.Host.ChoiceDescription -ArgumentList 'Docker Toolbox') ) Read-Prompt -Caption "Docker for Windows and Docker Toolbox are installed." -Message "Which one do you want to use?" -Choices $Choices -DefaultChoice 0

maml:description.maml:para: Displays a yes/no prompt.
The "Read-PromptYesNo" cmdlet displays a yes/no prompt and waits for the user's choice.

maml:Description.maml:para: The caption that is to be displayed.
The message that is to be displayed.
The choice that is selected by default.
The caption that is to be displayed.
The message that is to be displayed.
The choice that is selected by default.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- BEISPIEL 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Read-PromptYesNo -Message "Docker is not installed." -Question "Do you want to install it automatically?" -DefaultChoice 0

maml:description.maml:para: Checks whether an environment variable exists.
The "Test-EnvVarExists" cmdlet checks the existence of an environment variable and returns true on success.

maml:Description.maml:para: The environment variable's name that is to be checked.
The environment variable's name that is to be checked.

maml:description.maml:para: Checks whether a PowerShell module is installed.
The "Test-ModuleInstalled" cmdlet tries to get the desired module and return true on success.

maml:Description.maml:para: The module's name that is to be checked.
The module's name that is to be checked.

maml:description.maml:para: Checks whether an object's property exists.
The "Test-PropertyExists" cmdlet checks if an object contains a property name and returns true on success.

maml:Description.maml:para: The object that is to be checked for properties.
The object's property name that is to be checked.
The object that is to be checked for properties.
The object's property name that is to be checked.

maml:description.maml:para: Displays an indeterminate progress bar while a test is successful.
The "Wait-Test" cmdlet increases the progress bar's value in steps from 0 to 100 infinitely to provide visual feedback about a running task to the user.

maml:Description.maml:para: The task check which needs to pass.
A description of the running task.
The time to wait between test checks.
Whether to display a progress bar.
The task check which needs to pass.
A description of the running task.
The time to wait between test checks.
Whether to display a progress bar.

maml:description.maml:para: Displays a progress bar.
The "Write-ProgressBar" cmdlet displays a progress bar with a given progress percentage and a description of the currently running activity.

maml:Description.maml:para: The progress of the progress bar.
A description of the activity that is running.
The progress of the progress bar.
A description of the activity that is running.
